verses.text: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Beth-el, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.

And Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah his handmaid to be her maid.
These are the sons of Bilhah, which Laban gave unto Rachel his daughter, and she bare these unto Jacob: all the souls were seven.
The sons of Rachel Jacob's wife; Joseph, and Benjamin.

verses.text: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah's handmaid; Gad, and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, which were born to him in Padan-aram.

similars.text: And Zilpah Leah's maid bare Jacob a son.
These be the sons of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob in Padan-aram, with his daughter Dinah: all the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty and three.
These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter, and these she bare unto Jacob, even sixteen souls.
The sons of Leah; Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:
And Zilpah Leah's maid bare Jacob a second son.
And the sons of Jether; Jephunneh, and Pispah, and Ara.
These be the sons of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob in Padan-aram, with his daughter Dinah: all the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty and three.

verses.text: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre, unto the city of Arbah, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.

similars.text: Then Abram removed his tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and built there an altar unto the Lord.
And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padan-aram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob's and Esau's mother.
And Jacob came to Shalem, a city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padan-aram; and pitched his tent before the city.
And Jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.

verses.text: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.

similars.text: And all the days of Enoch were four hundred and thirty years.
And Abraham was an hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him.
And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.
Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the Lord blessed him.
When he shewed the riches of his glorious kingdom and the honour of his excellent majesty many days, even an hundred and fourscore days.
And Abraham was an hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him.
And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.

verses.text: And Isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.

similars.text: Then Abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
And when Jacob had made an end of commanding his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and yielded up the ghost, and was gathered unto his people.
Then Abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
And when Jacob had made an end of commanding his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and yielded up the ghost, and was gathered unto his people.
